metadata.title: Tuesday, 22nd October, 2013
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Finance what the legal basis for collecting money for the Strategic Fuel Reserve Fund is.
Vice President why the Government has allowed District Commissioners to publicly campaign for the Patriotic Front during Parliamentary and Local Government by-elections.
Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)when the Lwela Bridge which connects Milenge Boma to Senior Chief Milambo’s area will be repaired;
(b)what has caused the delay in repairing the Bridge; and
(c)what the estimated cost of the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)when Milenge High School will be officially opened; and
(b)what has caused the delay in opening the School.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)how many Zambians applied for prospecting permits for minerals in Solwezi District in 2012:
(b)of the total applications, how many were unsuccessful;
(c)of the unsuccessful applicants, how many appealed to the Minister from January to February, 2013; and
(d)whether the Minister has already considered the appeals.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    why the contract for the rehabilitation of the Mwinilunga-Solwezi (T5) Road was terminated;
(b)what the contract sum for the project was;
(c)how much of the contract sum had been paid to the contractor at the time of termination of contract;
(d)how much of the contracted works were completed; and
(e)whether there are any plans to find another contractor to complete the project.
(a)whether the Government has any plans to construct a health centre in Kafwanka area in Chembe Parliamentary Constituency;
(b)if so, what the estimated cost of the project is; and
(c)if not, what immediate measures the Government has taken to provide health services in the area.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education whether the Government has any plans to construct the following in Chembe Parliamentary Constituency
parts: (a)a secondary school in Lingomukuta; and
(b)a primary school at Kashila.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)what the teacher-pupil ratio at the following schools in Mwinilunga is:
(i)Kalumbinga Basic; (ii)Lunga High; (iii)Kanyihampa Basic; (iv)Kanyikomboshi High; and
(v)Ntambu High;
(b)what the recommended teacher-pupil ratio is; and
(c)what plans the Government has to improve the teacher-pupil ratio country-wide.

questions.minister: Minister of Chiefs and Traditional Affairs whether the following Chiefs in the North-Western Province whose recognitions were withdrawn before independence will be recognised again
parts: (a)Chief Mpulumba;
(b)Chief Katambi; and
(c)Chief Mukangala.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication when the Government will commence the upgrading of the Manyinga-Mwinilunga Road to bituminous standard.
parts: (a)how many Nursing Training Schools are operating in Zambia, province by province:
(b)what qualifications are obtained from the nursing schools at (a);
(c)of the nursing schools at (a), which ones train Registered Nurses;
(d)whether the Registered Nurses are allowed to go for advanced education at the University of Zambia, School of Medicine; and

(e)if so, how many nurses have been sponsored by the Government to go for advanced education at the University from 2010 to-date. W4    Mr Katuka (Mwinilunga) - to ask the Minister of Agriculture and Livestock:
(a)how many tonnes of maize were produced by farmers in Mwinilunga Parliamentary Constituency from 2010 to 2013, year by year;
(b)how much of the maize at (a) was purchased by the Food Reserve Agency in the same period, year by year; and

(c)what percentage of the total maize production for North-Western Province was produced by Mwinilunga District, year by year. ORDER OF THE DAY 1    Supply - Motion (11th October) - Resumption of Debate - (Mr Simbao).
